items.translated_title: Waymo continues robotaxi ramp up with Miami service now open to public

items.title: Ireland proposes new law allowing police to use spyware
items.creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai

items.translated_title: Ireland proposes new law allowing police to use spyware
items.content: The Irish government announced that it wants to pass a law that would grant police more surveillance powers, such as using spyware to fight serious crime, while aiming to protect the privacy rights of its citizens.

items.translated_title: Google’s AI Mode can now tap into your Gmail and Photos to provide tailored responses
items.content: The company notes that AI Mode doesn’t train directly on your Gmail inbox or Google Photos library. Instead, it trains on specific prompts and the model’s responses.

items.translated_title: Here’s what you should know about the US TikTok deal

images.alt: TikTok logo superimposed on Supreme Court building
Donald Trump speaking into a microphone against a backdrop of the sky. He is gesticulating with his hands.

items.content: A number of investors are competing for the opportunity to purchase the app, and if a deal were to go through, the platform's U.S. business could have its valuation soar to upward of $60 billion.

items.translated_title: Under Armour says it’s ‘aware’ of data breach claims after 72M customer records were posted online
items.content: TechCrunch obtained a sample of the stolen data, which contained names, email addresses, dates of birth, and the user's approximate geographic location. Under Armour confirmed some sensitive information was taken in the breach.

items.translated_title: From invisibility cloaks to AI chips: Neurophos raises $110M to build tiny optical processors for inferencing
items.content: Neurophos is taking a crack at solving the AI industry's power efficiency problem with an optical chip that uses a composite material to do the math required in AI inferencing tasks.

items.translated_title: Anthropic has to keep revising its technical interview test so you can’t cheat on it with Claude
items.content: The issue of AI cheating is already wreaking havoc at schools and universities around the world, so it's ironic that AI labs are having to deal with it too. But Anthropic is also uniquely well-equipped to deal with the problem.
